title: [BUG] error prediction with global model
body:
Hi,

I am using **hierarchical** data (sales forecast data from Kaggle competition) to train a global model. 

There are 10 stores and each store has 50 items. My train dataset (X_train) looks like as follow:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3079053/202317601-927cfc69-acdf-48c0-956c-70050b0499d3.png)

My train label dataset (prediction label is **sales**) is as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3079053/202317747-e7f472da-cc43-4652-b7a2-db0e5baa444f.png)

I have successfully trained a global model (using PySpark). The code is:

  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3079053/202321358-8ef09422-6da7-41cb-ae4b-14a292604dd2.png)

    
The output of fitted model is 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3079053/202318158-aa95fefa-b6a4-4dcd-9f2c-442f43872d4b.png)

I am trying to make predictions but getting an error message: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3079053/202320774-037cb023-72aa-4461-a4d9-4dbbfc9a5da8.png)

Please note that if I train model using Prophet (local model) then I can make predictions with no error. 
**It is a bug or intended behaviour ?  If it is not a bug can someone help me to resolve this issue ?** 

One more question ? Is there a way I can define Forecast Horizon using the following code : 

`fh_abs = ForecastingHorizon(y_test.index, is_relative=False) `
